hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
echo "# Below commands are to prepare the system to execute the desired script and also to capture few details of server "
cd /tmp ls -lah DIR=/tmp/doe-task # This will be the working directory for the whole setup if [ -d "$DIR" ]; then echo "repositry exist" else git clone git@github.com:sidbose87/doe-task.git # This step is clone the repo to working directory cd $DIR git checkout master && git pull echo "repository created and checked out to latest" fi
echo "# Below script os_details.sh is to capture few details about the operating system."
echo '#!/bin/bash' > os_details.sh echo 'if [ -f /etc/os-release ]; then' >> os_details.sh echo ' . /etc/os-release' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=$NAME' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$VERSION_ID' >> os_details.sh echo 'elif type lsb_release >/dev/null 2>&1; then' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=$(lsb_release -si)' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$(lsb_release -sr)' >> os_details.sh echo 'elif [ -f /etc/lsb-release ]; then' >> os_details.sh echo ' . /etc/lsb-release' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=$DISTRIB_ID' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$DISTRIB_RELEASE' >> os_details.sh echo 'elif [ -f /etc/debian_version ]; then' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=Debian' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$(cat /etc/debian_version)' >> os_details.sh echo 'elif [ -f /etc/redhat-release ]; then' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=RedHat' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$(cat /etc/redhat-release)' >> os_details.sh echo 'else' >> os_details.sh echo ' # For all other versions' >> os_details.sh echo ' OS=$(uname -s)' >> os_details.sh echo ' VER=$(uname -r)' >> os_details.sh echo 'fi' >> os_details.sh
echo 'case $(uname -m) in' >> os_details.sh echo 'x86_64)' >> os_details.sh echo ' BITS=64' >> os_details.sh echo ' ;;' >> os_details.sh echo 'i*86)' >> os_details.sh echo ' BITS=32' >> os_details.sh echo ' ;;' >> os_details.sh echo '*)' >> os_details.sh echo ' BITS=?' >> os_details.sh echo ' ;;' >> os_details.sh echo 'esac' >> os_details.sh
echo 'echo "OS, VERSION, BIT-VERSION" > /tmp/os_details.csv' >> os_details.sh echo 'echo "$OS, $VER, $BITS" >> /tmp/os_details.csv' >> os_details.sh
chmod 755 os_details.sh
./os_details.sh
cat /tmp/os_details.csv
echo "# Below commands needs to be executed with sudo permissions to create a named user, for script to run in next phase."
sudo useradd -m log-user 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true sudo mkdir /home/log-user/jenkins-scripts 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true sudo chmod -R o+rx /home/log-user/ 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true sudo chmod -R o+wx /home/log-user/jenkins-scripts/ 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true
echo "# Below command prepares for letting log-user run the next script as a service or daemon."
sudo mkdir -p /home/log-user/.config/systemd/log-user/ 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true sudo chmod -R o+rx /home/log-user/.config/systemd/ 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true sudo chmod -R o+wx /home/log-user/.config/systemd/log-user/ 2>/tmp/jenkins-error || true
